alert.note: Alert for Natrona County Lower Elevations; Southeast Johnson County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 10:15PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Natrona and south central Johnson Counties through 1045 PM MDT... At 1014 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Hole In The Wall, or 11 miles south of Kaycee, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Natrona and south central Johnson Counties. This includes Interstate 25 between mile markers 222 and 245. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Riverton.

area.areaDesc: Natrona County Lower Elevations; Southeast Johnson County
